A letter of very frequent occurrence amongst the Abipones‚ but which we Europeans are unacquainted with, is one ‘which has the mixed sound of R and G. To pronounce it pro- perly, the tongue must be slided a little along the roos of the mouth, and brought towards the throat‚ in the manner of those persons who have a natural incapacity of pronouncing the letter R. To signify this peculiar letter of the Abipones‚ we have written R or G indiscriminately, but distinguished by a certain mark, thus: Laetaffiaa a son: Aclzibifailc, salt. The plural number changes R into K, thus: Laetlfdte, sons.
